this file: /etc/resolv.conf but you need your primary DNS
thats what i did to get my network working
it was more so ubuntu/gnome was acting funny with my modem
hence
changing /etc/resolv.conf will not help if he can ping google.com ;)
all resolv.conf does is give you the ability to access hosts by name. if he can *ping* by name, DNS is working.
.mov is usually QucikTime
my point is, you should be using "apt-cache search quicktime" ;)
libquicktime0 - A library for reading and writing Quicktime files  <--- looks rather promising, eh? ;)
be aware, Apple changes their codecs about every 12 minutes, so libquicktime will allow playback of some stuff, but not every .mov you find.
